markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 23"
    pfs=""
>
[Hunter's Dawn](/Equipment.aspx?ID=674)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Extinction Curse</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Unique" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=161" />
<trait label="Arcane" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=11" />
<trait label="Artifact" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=253" />
<trait label="Enchantment" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=61" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #156: The Apocalypse Prophet](/Sources.aspx?ID=36) pg. 67</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Base Weapon** [Club](/Weapons.aspx?ID=2)
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

_Hunter's Dawn_ is a _+3 [greater striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [speed](/Equipment.aspx?ID=304) [ghost touch](/Equipment.aspx?ID=297) [club](/Weapons.aspx?ID=2)_. However, the notched head of the weapon marks it as an atlatl, an ancient tool used for throwing [darts](/Weapons.aspx?ID=68) and [javelins](/Weapons.aspx?ID=71). You can use _Hunter's Dawn_ with a mundane dart or javelin like you would use a bow with an arrow; when you do so, the range of the dart or javelin is doubled, and the dart or javelin uses _Hunter's Dawn_ to determine its attack modifier and damage dice.

<document level="2" id="action-534" />

<document level="2" id="action-535" />

<document level="2" id="action-536" />

**Destruction** _Hunter's Dawn_ can be destroyed only by placing it on the funeral pyre of a dead god.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Hunter's Dawn

However, the notched head of the weapon marks it as an atlatl, an ancient tool used for throwing darts and javelins. You can use Hunter's Dawn with a mundane dart or javelin like you would use a bow with an arrow; when you do so, the range of the dart or javelin is doubled, and the dart or javelin uses Hunter's Dawn to determine its attack modifier and damage dice. Destruction Hunter's Dawn can be destroyed only by placing it on the funeral pyre of a dead god.
